final_report.root_cause: compose-post-service failed to complete post composition because its Thrift client attempts to connect to post-storage-service:9090 were refused. compose-post is correctly configured to talk to post-storage-service but runtime logs show repeated TSocket connect() "Connection refused" and client-pool connection failures, indicating post-storage-service was not accepting TCP connections on port 9090. Those connection refusals caused compose-post to return internal/empty error payloads seen in traces and produced failing traces that include compose-post. Concurrently, reentrant/duplicated calls between user-mention-service and url-shorten-service amplified the error surface and appeared in all failing traces, but they are secondary contributors — the immediate blocking failure was post-storage-service refusing connections.
final_report.evidence_summary: 1) Distributed traces: all 6 slow traces (traceIDs listed) begin with nginx-thrift -> compose-post-service, include compose-post-service, and have has_error=true; many traces show repeated url-shorten and user-mention spans (duplicate/reentrant calls). 2) compose-post configuration: ConfigMap compose-post-service/service-config.json shows compose-post is configured to call post-storage-service at host 'post-storage-service' port 9090 with standard timeouts (timeout_ms=10000) — no misconfiguration of host/port or aggressive timeouts. 3) compose-post pod logs: multiple lines showing Thrift connection failures: "TSocket::open() connect() <Host: post-storage-service Port: 9090>: Connection refused" and "(ClientPool.h:114:Pop) Failed to connect post-storage-client", proving connection refusals to post-storage-service. 4) Compose-post Deployment status: ready/available replicas = 1 and no pod crash evidence, ruling out silent composer crashes. 5) Service/Endpoints check (user-mention): user-mention Service exposes port 9090 and has healthy endpoints, ruling out a compose->user-mention misconfiguration. Together these show the blocking fault is post-storage-service not accepting connections; the duplicate spans implicate application-level reentrancy between user-mention and url-shorten that amplifies latency/failures but do not explain the connection-refused symptom.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority-1 investigation (completed): inspected compose-post Deployment/Pod spec and mounted ConfigMap to verify Thrift client settings; fetched compose-post pod logs and observed repeated connection-refused errors to post-storage-service:9090; validated compose-post pod is running and not crashlooping. Conclusion: compose-post configuration is correct and errors are caused by the downstream post-storage-service refusing connections. Priority-2 investigation (completed): validated compose-post's user-mention endpoint in service-config.json and confirmed the Kubernetes Service and Endpoints for user-mention-service are present and healthy, disproving a misconfiguration hypothesis for user-mention. Trace analysis revealed repeated/reentrant calls involving url-shorten-service and user-mention-service in all failing traces, suggesting an application-level amplification loop that merits follow-up. Additional prioritized connection checks (post-storage-service pod/service health, and investigations into the user-mention/url-shorten reentrancy) remain in the pending task list but are not required to localize the primary failure.

evaluation.rca_motivation: The agent correctly identifies the failing component (post-storage-service) and the main symptom (connections to port 9090 being refused, causing compose-post failures). However, it attributes the issue to the service not accepting connections on 9090, rather than recognizing the specific mechanical cause: a misconfigured Kubernetes Service targetPort pointing to 9999 instead of the actual container port 9090. Thus it gets the component and symptom right but misses the precise root cause configuration error.
